com.digi.xbee.api.utils

Class HexUtils

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.digi.xbee.api.utils.HexUtils

  • public class HexUtils
extends Object
    Utility class containing methods to work with hexadecimal values and several data type conversions.

      • containsLetters

        public static boolean containsLetters(String parameter)
        Checks whether the given parameter is a string or a numeric value.
        Parameters:
        parameter - Parameter to check.
        Returns:
        true if the given parameter is a string, false otherwise.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if parameter == null.

      • integerToHexString

        public static String integerToHexString(int value,
                        int minBytes)
        Converts the given integer into an hexadecimal string.
        Parameters:
        value - The integer value to convert to hexadecimal string.
        minBytes - The minimum number of bytes to be represented.
        Returns:
        The integer value as hexadecimal string.

      • prettyHexString

        public static String prettyHexString(byte[] value)
        Converts the given byte array into an hex string and retrieves it in pretty format by splitting the content byte by byte.
        Parameters:
        value - The byte array to convert to pretty hex string.
        Returns:
        The hexadecimal pretty string.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if value == null.
        See Also:
        prettyHexString(String)

      • prettyHexString

        public static String prettyHexString(String hexString)
        Converts the given hexadecimal string to a pretty format by splitting the content byte by byte.
        Parameters:
        hexString - The hexadecimal string to convert.
        Returns:
        The hexadecimal string with pretty format.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if hexString == null.
        See Also:
        prettyHexString(byte[])
